title: Jhin is horrible with the new runes
body:
Feels like Jhin has taken a massive hit with these new runes. They fit most adc's perfectly but I just can't seem to find one that works properly on Jhin. 

I can't use any Precision keystone as i'll get 18% attack speed from the secondary one which is literally worthless until like full build (4 ad lvl 1 to be accurate), also Footwork heals me for like 30 a proc with 4 items, Bloodlust would've healed me for 400 without a crit at that point so I don't see a point in trying to run Footwork anyway. 

Dark Harvest and Electrocute are actually alright, you can take Precision as secondary and get "Coup De Grace" (for the execute) and  "Legend: Bloodline" to compensate for the lack of any sustain, with 8% life steal you won't have to buy any life steal item. And that's good cuz I never did thanks to Bloodlust. 
This seems somewhat alright but you will absolutely HAVE to run Precision secondary. 

One big downside to Domination Jhin is not being able to start Dorans Ring as the passive bonus is adaptable so you will get ap bonus instead if you do, and not buying it will cause you to lose a lot of early pressure and run out of mana often, and Essence Reaver is not even close as destructive as Statikk Shiv as third Crit item (after IE and RFC which I consider core items). 

On a slightly different note, even with Domination rune page and Dorans Ring/Long Sword start Jhin feels a lot weaker in early - mid game... I played him as a lane bully with safe Q+4th shot trades with my +14 lethality and +14 ad rune page which gave me decent early game and big power spike after first back if I get Dirk, and he scaled well on top of that. 

**so my ideal build was D Ring start, Dirk + boots or Dirk + cull on first B, BF sword on second, finish Ghostblade then IE or RFC rush, then Statikk and Last Whisper... Boot upgrade anywhere along the way, i'd buy any boots except the CDR ones.** And this felt a lot more powerful than what I have now with these new runes. 

Don't get me wrong, I love the new runes, they made the game a lot more fun and there is a lot more variety but it's just that it feels like Jhin took too much big of a hit.

replies.body:
So...you cannot be a bit less spammy with your spells early and you don’t want to sacrifice a bit more damage for more spell spam?

I’ve been running electrocute on him.
If I start Doran's Ring I'm sacrificing literally all of my lane phase damage for the wave clear/pressure. With old runes I could have both spell spam and damage. That's why I'm complaining.
Are you really though?  Coup de grace and cheap shot do a lot of damage with Jhin, especially combined with his fourth shot.
It gives him decent kill pressure which he already has a lot of, but it can't be compared with the damage 4th grenade bounce did with old runes that I mentioned.
I see. Ok I dabble in Jhin a little but I primarily go Doran’s into full crit Jhin and try to last hit with the grenade.

Dorans Ring or Blade?
It's good if you're going for Ring start, but the ability to Q every time it comes back up (whether for trade or last hits) is something you lose when starting Blade.

Blade. 

I don’t spam Q every time it comes back up. It can’t clear minions at level 1 so I use it for poke when able.

I'm a little surprised people aren't going the new warlord's on him.  Press the attack should work on him, especially for giving his 4th shot that big burst, but would need a level of management I don't think most players could pull off.

BTW, with manaflow band the OP probably wouldn't need to start ring.

I know that attack speed is good on Jhin in late game, but unlike you I prefer playing him as a lane bully and pressuring hard to set the enemy adc as far behind as possible to get me through Jhin's awkward mid game so I can proceed to one shot the hell out of everyone in late game. 

This could work but the 18% attack speed bonus from runes literally gives me 4 ad on lvl 1, compare that to my old rune page that was +14 ad +14 lethality. Not even close. 
Jhin could still be fine but my playstyle that is literally what made me a good Jhin player is pretty much dead. I would have to play him like the old Vayne now - make it through the horrible early game to get to late game. But there's a problem there unrelated to runes - after this new update my framerate stared dropping to 35 even in smaller fights after 20 min mark... I used to run the game at medium - high and never drop bellow 60 (vsync on) except in larger 40+ min teamfights which was one in 15 games, and now Zed ults at 25 min and my framerate is 45. They should look into this, it affects the playstyle that I'll need to work with heavily.
aery scales with ad and mana flow band makes him more spammy. It's not terrible. It's more of the precision talents synergizing much too well with adcs that were already strong.

it still doesn't give me even close as much mana as DRing used to give me, also its not about Precision synergizing too well with other adc's, its about it not giving ANYTHING to Jhin. 

Unrelated to Jhin the Fleet Footwork is literally useless... It heals for 20 at 25 mins. 

But even if I find a decent rune setup for Jhin it will never be the same again, you can just feel the difference in damage and it hurts seeing how little damage I do compared to what I did before preseason. Officially a shit tier adc now.
I agree that sorcery primary is very good for non attack speed marksman.

I ran Aery on him with the Doran's Ring start and that was alright.  You can reasonably throw Aery at someone consistently and be pretty annoying with the chip damage.  I do agree though, the keystones all feel really awkward on him.

Essentially, this entire post to me seems like a stubborn player who realizes that this game **CHANGES DRASTICALLY** on a regular basis, but refuses to adapt their play style to reflect this.

Jhin is on the upper tier of ADC's right now, with most players opting to go sorcery masteries into a lethality based build. Maybe they have some insight that you should adopt?

I already adapted my playstyle for the new runes, but he still feels a lot weaker and more unreliable than he used to be.
Comet works fine for my lane bully playstyle but it doesn't scale well into Jhin's destructive late game which is something Bloodlust contributed to with it's 800+  heals.
Manaflow Bond (or w/e it's called) does not give me as much pressure as Dring used to provide me with.
Legend: Bloodline does not heal nearly as much as Bloodlust used to.
The +2 lethality buff on lethality items does not even get close to the 14 lethality I had in old rune page, 14 lethality > 4 lethality (as I only go either one or two at most lethality items), and bonus 15 dmg every 20 seconds from that rune (w/e it's called) does not get close to 14 flat lethality.  
Everything he gets from new runes just feel like a lot weaker versions of his old builds, also unlike with most other adc's I'm stuck with Sorcery + Precision runes or else I will lose the little of what old Jhin (which was at least twice as good) had, and I can't even use the trees the other way around as that 18% attack speed from Precision does absolutely nothing for Jhin, and Fleet Footwork is a poor excuse of a keystone and a horrible Bloodlust wannabe that fails horribly at its attempt to be just that.

The game does change drastically every once in a while but a change this big that literally ruined the champ and made him as awkward like this is not something the game is trying to do, and I'm 100% sure that having some champs barely work with any keystones is not healthy for the game and the balanced state that it's trying to achieve.

Agreed that nearly all key runes are bad on Jhin, but I'm glad to see DRing is not an option anymore. I hated it when Jhins on my team started it. And I've never built it first, never had mana problems.
if you can't use precision go sorcery or inspiration. they will give you better stats anyway
